title: Elizabeth Olsen cuts a chic look as she covers up in a turtleneck and leather pants at SiriusXM
text:
Elizabeth Olsen stopped by the SiriusXM studio in New York City looking every inch a fall fashion queen.

The 30-year-old actress donned leather slacks, a sharp blazer and a high-neck blouse for her Tuesday visit.

The sister of twins Mary-Kate and Ashley Olsen currently stars in the second season of Sorry For Your Loss on Facebook Watch.

Fall chic: Elizabeth Olsen donned leather slacks, a sharp blazer and a high-neck blouse for her Tuesday visit to SiriusXM studios

The Marvel star was all smiles as she wore a fitted black blazer over the high-neck blouse.

Her tawny pants slightly flared at the knee and fell in the middle of her shin and met the top of her boots. They featured a three gold button-up closure.

For accessories, she carried a small, black crossbody bag on her right shoulder and covered her eyes with round, metal frame black sunglasses from Ray-Ban.

Leather lady: In a tawny color, her pants slightly flared at the knee and fell in the middle of her shin and met the top of her boots. They featured a three gold button up closure

Just like her sisters: Elizabeth showcased her chic style with her unique tan colored leather trousers for the press day

On her way to the studio the beauty let shaggy bangs fall on her face, while the rest of her hair was tied into a low bun.

She topped the look off with above the ankle black, heeled booties.

A small glimpse of her engagement ring was visible, on her left hand, as she headed inside.

Empowered: Earlier this week she talked to Us magazine about how she and her famous sisters were raised to be empowered women. She said 'At what point did my parents make me feel like a very strong female? I don’t really know how that happened but I always felt like a very empowered young female and it’s something that my sisters and I try to figure out'

Meanwhile, Olsen is set to star in a new Marvel spin-off for Disney's upcoming streaming service, which she teased in a new interview with BUILD Series.

'With WandaVision, I’m just so excited for fans because if they know anything about the Scarlet Witch in the comics, I just think this show will get them so excited,' Olsen said.

'This show will explore why she’s known as Scarlet Witch and how she is Scarlet Witch, as opposed to Wanda. We’ve always referred to her as Wanda in our films. So it’s an exciting opportunity,' she added.

Second season: Elizabeth also stars on Sorry For Your Loss as a new widow who, spinning from her loss, gives up writing her advice column and takes a job at her mother's fitness studio, the second season was released on Facebook Watch last week

Wandavision will be based around her MCU character Wanda Maximoff/Scarlet Witch and reunites her with Paul Bettany as Vision.

The two starred together in 2015's Avengers: Age of Ultron, 2016's Captain America: Civil War and 2018's Avengers: Infinity War.

Wandavision is tapped for a 2021 release.

Blouse: The Marvel star was all smiles as she wore a fitted black blazer over the high-neck blouse

She got engaged to her boyfriend of two-years, Robbie Arnett, 27, in late June of this year.

Her new piece of jewelry appeared to be of a cushion cut design with diamonds all around a large jade stone.



As she posed for photos inside, the cuffs of her white shirt were revealed as they peeked out under her blazer.

Elizabeth also stars on Sorry For Your Loss as a new widow who, spinning from her loss, gives up writing her advice column and takes a job at her mother's fitness studio.

Mamoudou plays Elizabeth's late husband on Sorry For Your Loss, while Jovan portrays her still living brother-in-law.

Wanda: Olsen is also set to star in a new Marvel spin-off for Disney's upcoming streaming service

Fiances: She got engaged to her boyfriend of two years Robbie Arnett in June

Earlier this week she talked to Us magazine about how she and her famous sisters were raised to be empowered women.

She said 'At what point did my parents make me feel like a very strong female? I don’t really know how that happened but I always felt like a very empowered young female and it’s something that my sisters and I try to figure out.'

'People should feel more strong as women now more than ever,' she added.
description: Elizabeth Olsen stopped by the SiriusXM studio looking every inch a fall fashion queen. The 30-year-old actress donned leather pants and a high neck blouse for her Tuesday visit.
